top_comment.text:
I feel like I am most like Cinna. He really supports Katniss and helps her 
become the best he can be. He brings out the best in her. I bring out the 
best in people around me because I always try and make people feel the best 
and that they are always welcomed. Like, in the first movie, Cinna 
supported Katniss when she had to go talk to Ceaser. Katniss was so 
nervous. All Cinna said was to act like she is talking to him. That is 
something I would say to a friend that is nervous about something. Plus, 
Cinna also loves fashion... So do I!! Overall, I am most like Cinna because 
he is supportive of the people around him.﻿
top_comment.author: Circusgirly

captions.text: [MUSIC - CHARITY VANCE, "ICING"]

-Hey, everyone,
I'm Mindy, and this

is Brooklyn from Cute
Girls Hairstyles.

Today we're going to show you
how to do a winding lace braid

or, as some people are
calling it, a carousel braid.

She wore this to
church the other day

and got a million comments and
I thought it looked amazing.

So we have started
by doing a ponytail.

I did a little
pompadour on the top

just to give it some
volume around her face

because I think it's more
flattering than being slicked
back.

And then we did a hair wrapped
pony, just to hide the elastic.

But you can do a very basic
ponytail if you want to.

Now when you get your
ponytail in place,

what you're going to do is
start right here, kind of

on the one side, and pick
up a little section of hair.

And you're going to begin
a basic three strand brand.

So we're going to
separate our strands

and then we're going to just go
ahead and do a single stitch.

When you get done
with one stitch,

then you're going to add
in hair to the top strand.

Now, this is what
a lace braid is.

Of course, if you don't
know, then a lace braid

is just when you only
add hair to one side--
and, in this case, the top.

So we're just going
to keep adding hair

into the top as we go along,
not to the bottom strand.

And you can see that
we're kind of moving

from one side of the
ponytail to the other.

And I'm moving in just a
slightly downward motion.
Spin her so you can see.

So I'm going to pick
up hair and add it in.

Now, when you get to the
opposite edge of the ponytail,

then you're going to just go
ahead and continue to do maybe

three or four stitches
of regular braid.

So stop adding hair in and
just braid for a minute.

Now you're going to take this,
wrap it underneath the ponytail
and to the other side.

You're going to go back and
find your three strands again.
Don't lose your fingering place.

And on that top strand, go
ahead and add in more hair.

So you're going to add
in hair right there.

And go ahead and continue to
lace braid at this point again.

Again, we're going to work
from one side of the ponytail

to the other and
we're going to go

in a very slight downward
angle as we go along.

And this is why I call it
winding lace braid because it

just looks like it winds
around the rest of the hair.

And I don't know where the
word carousel came from for it,

but perhaps because it
goes around and around,

like a carousel would
What do you think?
-Yeah.

That seems like a
good assumption.
-OK.

Again, when we get
to the side, we're

going to go ahead and do a
few stitches of regular braid.

Take it under the ponytail
to the other side.
Separate them off again.
Find your stranding.

And go ahead and pick up hair,
add it to that top piece,

and continue to work
your way around again.

Now, you can do it as many
times around the ponytail
as you want.

If you only want one
or two, that's fine.

If you have really long hair
and you pull off three or four,
that's great, too.

It's just going to kind of
depend on the length of hair

and how far down
the ponytail you
go before you stop braiding.

So we're winding
around again here.

And do maybe one
more on this side.

Again, this is the
lace braid portion.
One more.
And again, do a few stitches.

Now you can see I'm
nearing the end of my hair.

So I'm going to go take
it around one more time.

And then I'm going to secure
it with an elastic, just right
at the end.

Or I have an even
smaller elastic,
which will look better.

Now, when you let
go, the hair is

going to loosen
just a little bit.

And that's OK, because that's
exactly the effect we want.

So you can see we have a
tier and a tier and a tier,
and then into the end.

And it looks amazing
and beautiful

and people are going to
really wonder how on earth you

got this great braid that goes
all the way around the hair.

So I hope you guys
have enjoyed--
what do you think of that one?
-I like it.
I think it's super cute.
-I do, too.

And I think that
you need to send me

pictures of other suggestions
you would like me to try.

You can send them
to me at my Twitter
account, which is @CuteGirlHair.
You can just Tweet them to me.

And we'd love to
hear from you guys.
And we will see you next week.
Bye.
-See you.
[MUSIC - CHARITY VANCE, "ICING"]
-[INAUDIBLE].
-Oh, it's popping.
It's popping.
[POPPING]
-[INAUDIBLE].

title: Winding Lace Braid Ponytail Cheat | Cute Girls Hairstyles
